ca.gedge.opgraph.nodes.math
Class MathExpressionNode

java.lang.Object
  ca.gedge.opgraph.OpNode
      ca.gedge.opgraph.nodes.math.MathExpressionNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
NodeSettings, Vertex, Extendable
public class MathExpressionNode
extends OpNode
implements NodeSettings

A node that computes a value from a mathematical expression.

getSignificantDigits

public int getSignificantDigits()
Gets the number of decimal places that are significant in the expression result. If negative, all decimal places are significant. If zero, the result will always be an integer.

Returns:
the number of significant digits

setSignificantDigits

public void setSignificantDigits(int significantDigits)
Sets the number of decimal places that are significant in the expression result. If negative, all decimal places are significant. If set to zero, the result will always be an integer.

Parameters:
significantDigits - the number of significant digits.

operate

public void operate(OpContext context)
             throws ProcessingException
Description copied from class: OpNode
Have this node perform its operation. The given OpContext contains all inputs supplied by other nodes (if any) and can be acquired by OpContext.get(Object). If an input is optional, it is up to the implementing class to call OpContext.containsKey(Object) to see if the input was supplied. Finally, computed outputs should be placed into the given context under the appropriate OutputFields.

Specified by:
operate in class OpNode
Parameters:
context - the working context
Throws:
ProcessingException - if any errors occurred during the operation
